This movie is HOPE!
Superman (2025) finally portrays the character exactly as he should be: loving, caring, incorruptible, and driven by an unshakable will to save lives and prevent death, no matter who is in danger. He inspires people to do good simply by being himself. This Superman loves life, and the film makes kindness and optimism its central themes, which is what superman is all about. 

The tone is (finally) readjusted from the darker, conflicted and "edgy" versions we‚Äôve seen in recent years, to a bright, colorful, and uplifting theme, which truly fits the character better. It feels like a true return to the heart of Superman, while still feeling fresh and modern. 

Loved how the film introduced new and lesser-known characters, such as Mr. Terrific, in a re-imagined and genuinely cool way. They managed to make these secondary heroes likable and engaging, while the story never loses focus on the main character. It remains a Superman movie (not a Justice League movie) while still expanding the world!

The music deserves its own praise. The score reimagines the classic Superman theme in a modern style, and it fits perfectly. Blending nostalgia with a powerful and updated sound!

Heartwarming, fun, incredibly relevant in today's climate.

As soon as I saw Krypto the Super Pooch, I was out.  But then the reviews made me curious, and the trailer showed some humor, so I decided to give it a try.

Better than I thought!  They somehow managed to make both a really old school Superman, with boy scout values, and permanently modeled super-hair, and at the same time put him in a modernized world that could barely understand him, and which he could barely understand.  Lex Luthor was definitely the most formidable Luthor yet.  

And the movie makers found a way around the fatal flaw of Superman as a character--that he's the Swiss-army knife of superheroes, and is invincible unless someone can find yet another piece of that little green rock.  By taking a bit of the piss out of Superman and the other heroes (thank you Incredibles and The Boys), while investing in his simple goodness in a morally compromised world, they were able to make fun of this classic superhero and make love to him at the same time.  

And he took it like a champ!

Superman is simultaneously the most powerful metahuman ever seen but gets beaten up by B graders every 15 minutes. He needs rescuing more often than Lois Lane in the George Reeves series.

He's supposed to have super-speed but Lex Luthor can dictate fighting moves to beat him up in real time. Speaking of Lex, he is simultaneously the smartest and dumbest person on the planet. To top it all, Jor El and Lara sent him to Earth to be a despot and mass 'struggle-cuddler'.

‚ÄúSuperman (2025)‚Äù ‚Äî ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÜ

If you‚Äôre looking for a superhero film that balances spectacle with heart, this new Superman delivers. Lex Luthor (played by Nicholas Hoult) is suitably menacing and clever ‚Äî not just a mustache-twirling villain, but a real threat to Clark‚Äôs world. Superman (David Corenswet) feels both powerful and vulnerable, making his journey engaging without becoming predictable.

The action sequences are solid ‚Äî the ice crystal / robot battles had real visual flair ‚Äî and Krypto steals scenes (in both goofy and savage ways). The humor lands more often than not, and the moments between characters (especially Clark and Lois) give the film emotional weight. Some pacing issues creep in toward the finale, and there‚Äôs a lot to juggle with supporting characters, but overall it‚Äôs a refreshing, fun reboot that honors the myth and feels worthy of the cape.

Score: 86% fresh (estimated) ‚Äî a strong showing that suggests this new ‚ÄúMan of Tomorrow‚Äù era is off to a compelling start.

This movie is pretty much perfection as far as I‚Äôm concerned. Characters are just how I imagined them to be, and the director somehow managed to make this movie feel like a Christopher Reeves Superman movie and a modern day action movie at the same time (I give most of the Christopher Reeves movie likeness credit to Lex. His actor made the character feel so evil that he was on the verge of being campy at times, and I mean that in a good way).

I do have one minor gripe with it that knocks it down half a star, but it‚Äôs only because I‚Äôm incredibly detail oriented and wanted a specific thing out of the story that would‚Äôve made Clark‚Äôs character, in my opinion, better. But an action packed plot can‚Äôt deliver on everything, especially a little detail that happens during the climax. And, if you blink, you‚Äôll miss it, so I won‚Äôt badger it too hard. Yeah. It‚Äôs a good movie. Which, at this point, probably comes at no shock to you. I‚Äôm looking forward to the sequel.

I really wanted this to be a success. I grew up watching Christopher Reeve and the Superman original movies, which set a clear benchmark, but I've loved all the superman movies since with Brandon Routh and of course Henry Cavill.... until this one came along. I don't normally write movie reviews, but I felt compelled to in this instance, because it was just such a monumental disappointment and it delivered the worse possible attribute of any movie - a complete lack of emotion. I felt no joy, no sadness, no thrill - it was the most forgettable and emotionless superhero movie that I've ever watched. I didn't bond with any of the characters - there were too many of them and none of them had any real back story, so I was completely detached from all of them. Gunn is known for bringing fun and humour to his movies, which worked wonderfully well in the Marvel franchise, but failed miserably here. The script was awful and some of the characters just lacked any substance whatsoever - like Clark's parents or Hawkgirl, for example. The whole movie was just a 2 hour forgettable mess. And the notion that Superman was saving bloody squirrels and dogs whilst entire cities were being devastated with no human fatalities was just utter nonsense that is quite frankly insulting the intelligence of its audience. I know everyone reading this is thinking I'm a Snyderfan and just want him back. I don't - but honestly, ANYONE else would be better than Gunn. Please don't let him make any more Superman movies.

This movie genuinely made me feel like a kid again! I missed the magical feeling when I first watched the Christopher reeve movies and this film made me tear up a little bit when it ended! Call it nostalgia I don't care this movie is amazing definitely going to watch it again great job! SUPERMAN IS BACK!!!!!!!

However this movie captures the young and vibrant feeling that comes with being first introduced to the Superman comics. Captures his own characters trials while still embodying the seriousness of the story. Enjoyed the humor, color and overall story telling. Not everything is perfect. But not everything needs to be.

One of the best movies I've seen and certainly the best Superman movie. David brings exactly what I've always wanted to see from Superman to the big screen. Batman has always been my favorite superhero due to his unwavering commitment to his beliefs and acting on what he knows is right. His compassion, kindness, morals, dignity, and ability to give even the worst of society fairness is more superhuman then most superheros. David brings this aspect back to Superman. Those were all true things for the Superman I knew growing up. It was nostalgic, and unbelievably touching. This movie makes me want to be a better person. I cried, laughed, gasped, and had a big goofy smile across my face several times. I will cherish all the warm and fuzzies I got watching this for the first time. I will cherish this Superman forever. David is Superman, the real Superman. The casting was incredible for this, I'm still in absolute awe. Its an emotional roller-coaster and the music is absolutely beautiful. The song that plays as he's rising from the dust of smashed building gave me chills. My favorite scene was absolutely the part where he was sitting outside talking with his dad. Also the scene where he was laid down on his childhood bed as his parents comforted him, there something so sweet about it. 
‚ÄúI‚Äôm as human as anyone. I love, I get scared. I wake up every morning and despite not knowing what to do, l put one foot in front of the other and I try to make the best choices I can. I screw up all the time, but that is being human. And that‚Äôs my greatest strength.‚Äù - Superman

The era of superhero movies is well over.
I will get into heavy spoilers so be warned:

1. This has to be the dumbest Lex Luthor version I have seen. The whole plot is happening because he wants to create a country Luthoria and Superman is in his way...
2. He controls Superman's clone by screaming commands through a radio while the clone is fighting Superman. Commands like: 3B!!!! 1A!!!! And then clone executes those commands as ...special moves which Superman somehow can't keep up with.
3. Somehow Krypto is unable to follow a single command, joke that is funny first 2 times and gets sooooo overused that by the end it's more fun to watch paint dry.

And that's just few gripes...I'm not going to list them all here. I wasted 2h of my life on this...not gonna waste more.

It is commandable that they tried to make Superman more...light hearted...colorful...but what they should have focused on was good plot...and that was completly skipped.

The best superman film since Christopher Reeve's Superman. This was a great first outing, loved the cast. James Gunn put a lot of the weird and obscure DC elements in and it made the movie so unique and fun. Elements of the original score were here and there and helped the movie emotionally, though Gunn is great at creating emotional moments anyway. Fans have been begging for a long time - just make us care!! I really cared about the characters in this movie. And finally moving into the nowish future we got a super genius Lex Luthor who is scary! I can say I've never been scared or felt real stakes from a Lex Luthor character, and finally that mark was hit. 

All around great, no complaints, go see this if you haven't already

Superman: 2025 delivered a hot pie of hope to my doorstep when I watched it. The visuals are amazing, and it feels like it was ripped straight out of a comic book. It gives Superman that Boy Scout feel that he‚Äôs lacked since the Richard Donner adaptations in 1978. It‚Äôs amazing how feel-good this movie is, and Superman is so‚Ä¶ human. He‚Äôs so real and so charismatic and so kind to everyone and everything. It‚Äôs beautiful. Rachel Brosnahan also did an amazing job portraying Lois Lane, and gave her character the most justice ever seen on the big screen, same with Nicholas Hoult‚Äôs Lex Luthor, though I can‚Äôt say I‚Äôm surprised. Beautiful movie, once again, James Gunn is a genius. Must-Watch.

This movie is a complete disaster and an insult to the Superman legacy. It strips away everything that makes the character iconic and turns him into a weak, whiny shell of a hero. Instead of the powerful, awe-inspiring figure who stands for hope and strength, we‚Äôre left with a childish, ridiculous version that ruins the entire mythos. The story is nonsensical, the tone is juvenile, and every bit of ‚Äúcoolness‚Äù that Superman should have is completely absent. It doesn‚Äôt just miss the mark‚Äîit destroys it. If you value Superman as a character, avoid this movie at all costs.

Thank goodness for fast forward.  I‚Äôm watching it on BluRay (Thank you library),  i can‚Äôt blame the actors, but the storyline and such is an embarrassment to the Superman movie series.  First, he is not a meta human; stop calling him that.  Somehow Luthor magically creates an ‚Äúultra man‚Äù (no backstory) and a nanotechnology powered ‚Äúengineer‚Äù.  I got as far as them strolling into the Fortress in Antarctica.  There is no real security; it just opened for Lex.  All the robots are destroyed, and the ‚Äúengineer‚Äù connects, downloads, translates and walks away with the entire contents of his Krytonian computer.  Then the fast forward kicked in.  Social media manipulating human opinion, etc.  his own super friends turn on him.  Blah, blan blah.   Henry Cavill should thank the powers that be that he was replaced.

Question:  when they dove back into the atmosphere from space, what happened to the heat?

BTW, hair doesn‚Äôt have dna.  The follicle yes, but the strand no.

I thought it was pretty fine. I appreciate what it does as the cinematic genesis for this new Gods and Monsters DCU, but it definitely could've been way better. If they took time to flesh out more shots, color grading, music, etc. I mean it literally was rushed production wise because it was announced less than 2 yrs ago. Despite this the actors do a stupendous job. Mr Terrific in particular was so good.
He felt capable and almost robotic in a cool way which fits his character. Nathan Fillion as Guy was like he was playing a different person altogether from his usual roles. I will say I wish we got closure on the tension between him and Superman. I didn't like how Guy called him a wuss for caring about saving lives but then the movie doesn't pay that off. At least in Black Adam, (which this movie is very similar to), Hawkman and Adam got to square off their differences. I gotta say without Krypto this movie would be even worse. Most of the heart and soul is poured into the dog. Not that that's a bad thing but l'm not a fan of movies relying on the cute character in favor of character. Wasn't a fan of Baby Groot or Grogu much. I hope we see Streaky down the line, but SPOILERS mean we won't? Lex, Lois, and Kal were great. The actors were good as their characters. Not out of this world or anything, but just fine. Nicholas Hoult's take on Lex will win those who didn't like Jessie's take for sure. This just felt like a pilot of a show. I mean, even Smallville had a better pilot.
Also the character at the end telt like it could've been handled better. The villain reveal I mean. Feels like a lot of what happens in this movie is just to save it for later.
The MCU did this as well but at least they put the work in for each movie so that you can enjoy it as a whole experience and not a piece of a slice of a pie.
Definitely a different brush stroke from the previous Superman. Unfortunately, I felt no real connection with any of the characters.

Oh my. For many years I stopped re-watching Mr Reeves Superman because of the very sad accident that happened to him. As with many people, the strength and determination he showed in his life was especially poignant given the iconic role he had played in the movie. When, a year or so I went back to the movie I could reflect on how brilliant was the movie and how brilliant Mr Reeves was in it. this is a movie that will be watched for generations to come.
I understand the challenge that the new movie faced. It could hardly be as good as the Richard Donner movie - Donner's movie had everything - a lightness of touch, a way of communicating a comic book feel on celluloid. A joy. I think it's also a testament to the movie that the Director's cut is pretty awful - the problem with the cut is that it extends a conversation Superman has with his Dad and it sits so badly in the movie. In the original cut we have a movie that is a great movie yet doesn't need to be be deep and meaningful - we can take joy from simplicity and fun and Superman - the original cut has oddles of that.
So when you remake what do you do? There's very few movies that manage to marry action and comedy as well as the original Superman (the only other one I can think of off the top of my head is Richard Lester's Three and Four Musketeers which has the same kind of joy and slapstick that Superman has. So comedy and action are a very difficult needle to thread.
So instead what the present Superman goes for is serious endeavour, weighty themes and angst and a deeper exploration of Lois and Clark/ Superman's relationship. In Richard Donner's movies what was interesting about the relationship with Clark and Lois and Superman and Lois was the sense that while Lois is really into Superman with Clark - not so much. For Clark/ Superman there's a lovely expansion of this when Clark tells Lana Lang that Superman can't turn she replies that she prefers spending time with him (Clark) anyway.
We get none of that in the present movie. I suspect what they were trying to go for was the idea of how would an alien be able to form a relationship with another species and negotiate a relationship. That could have been interesting but instead Superman/Clark in the present movie comes across as an emotioanally inaccessible person with anger management issues.
In another scene while other heroes are dealing with a baddie, Superman carries on talking to Lois - remember in the Donner movies Superman only ignores a cry for help because he has been infected and his evil side comes out. In the present movie he ignores a cry for help because - well I'm not quite sure - is this modern living - you may be a superhero but you have a relationship to deal with don't you know.
The acting isn't bad, you have to give them credit for playing their parts with such a dreary script (I supose as an actor you could hope that after taking the money you could feel more secure and hopefully in the future you won't have to do this kind of dross)
Oh and Nicholas Hoult is in it and it has to be said that any script that manages to make Mr Hoult look ordinary in an actor role should receive some kind of credit. Mr Hoult is one of the most interesting actors working today but it's criminal that such a talented actor has to work with material like this. None the less Mr Hoult and all the cast commit themselves admirably to their work - it's just a real shame that the script didn't justify the time and effort everyone was going to put in making this movie.

Of all the Superman movies that have been in the past, this new Superman movies really disappoints. Cheezy dialogue, cheezy graphics, some really stupid characters. Then we see all types of alien beings. Superman gets his butt kicked many times, so it didn't make sense as to why he wasn't as strong as we've known him to be. Then they create this universe pocket portal which really threw it into another direction. It was more like Superman meets Spaceballs while in a Dr. Strange multiverse. It got way too crazy and too stupid. Glad I didn't pay to see this in the theater!

To say that this was an uninspiring take on an iconic character like Superman, is an understatement! Granted, it doesn't try to retell the origin story of Superman, which was appreciated. However, the plot seemed MISSING! I understand that this Superman was designed to be "more human" and less God-like but he spends almost all of the movie getting the brakes beat off of him by any and everybody!  He is unsure of himself, comes across as a pacifist who doesn‚Äôt want to hurt a fly, and his emotional arc is sort of laughable. David Corenswet‚Äôs casting for Superman was spot on, and I enjoyed the like comedic quirks that he brought to the film. 

However, this film tries to throw some half-baked, spoofed characters (Green Lantern, Hawkgirl, Krypto, and even Supergirl) in that seem to be more powerful than the man of steel. The casting was COMPLETELY off for Lantern with an out of shape softball-dad with a really bad hairpiece! Why did Kent‚Äôs parents sound like they were some country bumkins from the bible belt rather than from Kansas? Hoult‚Äôs performance as Lex Luther was fantastic, but even he couldn‚Äôt save this film. Feels like a rushed job and I wouldn‚Äôt waste your time with this one. I feel sorry for those who don‚Äôt know the story of Superman because this film leaves you scratching your head and wondering why you would waste 2+hrs. Superman is definitely not the star of his own movie!
Even getting the shite beat out of him, Superman remains the greatest superhero.

I guess I had high expectations of this movie, but it certainly wasn't what I expected - and not in a good way...

This movie was complex from the start - metahumans from other "creations" on planet earth with Superman not even demonstrating his "super" powers throughout most of the movie (getting his butt kicked most of the time) - it was an eclectic mix of a "wanna-be" superman with Green Lantern character and other strange metahumans who possessed forces of nanomites in what seemed like a messed up version of Dr. Strange's Multiverse movie. I couldn't make heads of tails of this - then there's the dog which was never in any previous superman movie before...

Then there's this other character who flies around in a virtual computer chair with monitors around him with the Lantern character - what?!....omg...

And the opening of the movie with Lois and Superman arguing in her apartment which was the most irritating to watch - it was worse than a soap opera and Superman engaged in it and even called people "goons" which he has never done in any previous movie before (it would be SO out of his character to do this) - WTF is going on?!

I give kudos to the creativity of this film, but I was greatly disappointed as this movie actually disrespected the character of this movie and the story/plot was just all over the place!
Bad effects, it looks childish, you don‚Äôt see a serious movie

SPECTACULAR! If you want to be taken away to wonderment, away from today's worry and strife, this is it. Mesmerizing from start to finish - fastest 2 hours ever. The best was how it left me feeling at the end - stronger, uplifted, something forgotten then regained about goodness in the world, a reminder that there really are good things, good people on Earth.  
This whole movie seemed a work of love, actors carefully chosen, detail, direction and writing, cgi, everything FANTASTIC. So many movies today seem catty, bitter, wry, dry, violent, demented or filled with negativity. This movie was different. As if symbolizing a paradigm shift, bringing back some forms of wholesomeness, morality, true justice in a pure and more forthright form. 
Loved the consideration for animals. Krypto was a total delight! 
The fighting was a bit much, but many will probably love the action, the depth of emotions, the dark and the light. 
Not only rented, but then bought it as well. A true re-watch over and over. Haha, also buying the other Superman movies too! Superman 1, II and Returns for SURE. This is one of the best movies EVER.

Amazing movie, so fun from start to finish. For all the walnuts claiming that ‚ÄúSuperman isn‚Äôt strong enough‚Äù, did you really want another superhero movie where the hero is basically invincible and nothing is ever at stake? Also, Superman was incredibly strong in this movie. He flew into space while being dragged down by the Engineer and his literal clone. Also, he did that while having his body completely covered by nanobots and his lungs filled with nanobots. He then flies directly into the ground to kill Engineer and get them off of him. If that ain‚Äôt extreme strength, idk what is. Also, for anyone complaining about how hard his fights were with Ultraman, consider that Ultraman has identical powers to Superman and he‚Äôs controlled by a super-genius who has studied Superman‚Äôs every move and devised counter-moves for every situation. Frankly, it‚Äôs a miracle Superman was able to get out of that alive. 

Moral of the story, Superman was awesome and it was refreshing to see a superhero movie where the hero isn‚Äôt completely invicible and actually faces some adversity. 

Also, extra points for Punkrocker during the credits.

Therefore, I couldn't enjoy the movie. I can only critique it throughout the entire time of me watching the movie and it's just seemed bad. Nicholas who played Lex Luthor excellent job!

This Superman story doesn't hold a candle compared to Superman: The Movie (1978). There is no character building - we are just thrown into these Metahuman's lives with no backstory at all. Somehow Mister Terrific sounds exactly like Robert Downey Jr's character in Tropic Thunder, which is hilarious considering that context. The trailers for this film were excellent, but the movie itself lacks everything needed to be taken seriously.
I regret buying this movie. It was so bad I could not finish watching it.

Wow.  After seeing the incredibly high rating, I'm questioning whether I can ever trust RT ratings again.  

I don't believe I've EVER stopped watching a mainstream, major studio, superhero movie but in full agreement with my wife, we stopped this one not 1/2 hour in.  

I made it past the silly setup they had to give to start where they started.  Not a big deal, Star Wars always does this.  I made it past the stupid "super dog" and the British robots.  I made it past the 15 second sun recharge and (barely) made it past The Boyz style, supposedly lab created super humans with flying, boomerang style saw blades in their hands and their goofy boss who had limitless tech and wealth but when they released a 2 foot high fire breathing Bowser (like the Super Mario boss) that grew to over 100 feet, I reached my limit.  

This is an insult to the franchise.  Truly pathetic.  How little is left of your taste and expectations if you actually enjoyed this.  Wow.
This was really bad.  I liked the actors, but the script was just stupid.

From the director of Guardians of the Galaxy, comes another great funny super hero movie with an emotional charge and beautiful cgi, James Gunn is setting up the stage for a great DC comeback or so I hope.

Oh my god....  I saw the first Christopher Reeves Superman movies at the cinema. I found the excitement of the introduction with Crypto again. Fan of the comics, fan of the cartoons, fan of hearing the music when Superman goes back into battle... wow, thank you. Super happy. Just one problem... Green Lantern and his team, well, especially him... it's totally out of the atmosphere and the film... we'll just forget that.
In my opinion, they depicted Superman as a little weaker than most tv and movies. But A good movie overall. Love the casting for Mr. Terrific.
This is the worst movie I've seen in a long time. I'd rather stab my eyes than have to sit through this again. I truly don't understand how anyone could possibly recommend it

Horrible Movie!!
